item.title: 中国电动汽车丰收年正加速汽油车的消亡
item.description:
石油市场已开始依赖世界第二大经济体作为增长的主要动力，但快速电气化正在以超出许多人预期的速度改变这一局面。【原文：

The oil market has come to rely on the world’s No. 2 economy as a key driver of growth, but rapid electrification is changing that faster than many anticipated.

】

item.description: 一名工人在亚利桑那州凤凰城的一家履行中心卸下一箱箱商品。摄影师： 约书亚-洛特//布鲁姆伯格【原文：A worker unloads boxes of merchandise at a fulfillment center in Phoenix, Arizona. Photographer: Joshua Lott//Bloomberg】

item.title: 关税风险逼近，惠普为特朗普就职基金捐款
item.description: 惠普公司正在为唐纳德-特朗普的就职典礼捐款，与微软公司、亚马逊公司和其他大型科技公司一道，为这位誓言要征收全面关税的美国新任总统本月的就职典礼提供资金。【原文：HP Inc. is making a contribution to Donald Trump’s inauguration, joining Microsoft Corp., Amazon.com Inc. and other major technology companies funding festivities this month for the incoming US president who has vowed to impose sweeping tariffs.】

item.title: 巴西通胀略有降温，但 2024 年底仍远超目标
item.description: 巴西的年度通胀率在 2024 年底略有下降，但仍远高于目标值，因为央行行长们发出信号，他们将至少再加息两次，以抑制物价上涨。【原文：Brazil’s annual inflation eased slightly at the end of 2024 while remaining well above target, as central bankers signal they will deliver at least two more jumbo interest rate hikes to tame price increases.】

item.title: CES 上的新玩意儿让特朗普成了科技公司首席执行官们关注的焦点
item.description: 本周，来自世界各地的技术首席执行官在罪恶之城会面，他们的话题不仅仅是人工智能、机器人和智能电视。但首先...【原文：Technology CEOs from around the world met in Sin City this week and the conversation was about more than just artificial intelligence, robots and smart TVs. But first...】

item.title: 无人驾驶农机和机器人：食品技术发展日新月异
item.description: 在洛杉矶北部的一家工厂里，无人驾驶叉车、机械臂和机械钳每天帮助挤压多达 160 万磅的柠檬。现在，这些机器人大军正在从事快餐连锁店 Chick-fil-A 员工的乏味工作。【原文：Driverless forklifts, robotic arms and mechanical jaws help squeeze as many as 1.6 million pounds of lemons a day at a factory north of Los Angeles. The army of robots are now doing what was a tedious task for staff at fast-food chain Chick-fil-A.】

item.title: 沃尔格林美国药店销售额超出市场预期
item.description: 沃尔格林博姿联盟公司（Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc.【原文：Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. reported quarterly results that surpassed Wall Street’s expectations, easing pressure on the pharmacy chain as it mulls strategic options including a sale.】

item.title: 去年全球票房跌幅比美国更大
item.description: 好莱坞高管和影院老板经常为美国电影票房惨淡而忧心忡忡。事实证明，海外情况更糟。【原文：Hollywood executives and theater owners have fretted loudly and often about the tough box-office in the US. Turns out it’s worse overseas.】

item.title: 印度 11 月工业产值增长至六个月新高
item.description: 印度 11 月份的工厂产出增至六个月来的最高水平，从而提振了部分经济部门出现反弹的希望。【原文：India’s factory output rose to the highest in six months in November, boosting hopes that some sections of the economy were seeing a rebound.】

item.title: 土耳其将因加沙战争第二年抵制达沃斯论坛
item.description: 土耳其总统雷杰普-塔伊普-埃尔多安（Recep Tayyip Erdogan）将把该国因加沙战争而对达沃斯世界经济论坛的抵制延长一年，高层经济官员也将跳过本月的聚会。【原文：Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan will extend the country’s Gaza war-related boycott of the World Economic Forum in Davos for another year, with top economic officials set to skip this month’s gathering.】

item.title: 前英格兰银行官员称里夫斯可能不得不废除税收承诺
item.description: 前英格兰银行利率制定者马丁-韦尔（Martin Weale）表示，如果市场利率进一步上升，英国工党政府可能不得不放弃不对工薪阶层增税的宣言承诺。【原文：Britain’s Labour government may have to ditch its manifesto promise not to raise taxes on working people if market interest rates rise much further, according to former Bank of England rate-setter Martin Weale.】

item.title: Centrica 警告称英国天然气储备冻结后 "低得令人担忧
item.description: Centrica Plc 表示，随着英国气温骤降，供暖需求增加，英国天然气储备处于 "令人担忧的低水平"。【原文：Centrica Plc says that the UK’s gas reserves are at “concerningly low” levels as freezing temperatures grip the country, boosting demand for heating.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚在对工资和养老金增长持谨慎态度的情况下保持利率不变
item.description: 塞尔维亚连续第四个月保持借贷成本不变，选择了谨慎行事，因为包括公共工资和养老金上涨在内的因素对物价造成了持续压力。【原文：Serbia kept borrowing costs unchanged for a fourth month, opting for caution as factors including public wage and pension increases maintain pressure on prices.】

item.title: 陷入困境的国债市场期待就业报告带来喘息机会
item.description: 受挫的美国政府债券市场正在寻求周五 12 月份就业报告的缓和。【原文：The beaten-down US government bond market is looking for a reprieve from Friday’s December employment report.】

item.title: Quanterix即将全股收购Akoya生物科学公司
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Quanterix公司正在进行收购生命科学同行Akoya Biosciences公司的谈判，交易将以全股票形式进行。【原文：Quanterix Corp. is in advanced talks to acquire life sciences peer Akoya Biosciences Inc. in an all-stock deal, according to people familiar with the matter, potentially combining two companies that detect diseases at different stages of progression.】

item.title: 华尔街警告股市需要 "金发碧眼 "的美国非农就业报告
item.description: 就业机会太多？股票下跌。就业岗位太少？股票仍然下跌。【原文：Too many jobs? Stocks fall. Too few jobs? Stocks still fall.】

item.title: 华尔街从就业报告中看到股市风险
item.description: 降息对股市牛市有多重要？对于风险资产投资者来说，这是一个迫切的问题，他们最近一直在努力忽视债券市场对通胀风险的激动反应。【原文：How important are rate cuts to the bull case on equities? It's a pressing question for investors in risky assets, who've lately struggled to ignore the bond market's agitated reaction to inflation risk.】

item.title: 加拿大计划在特朗普发动贸易战时采取广泛的关税报复措施
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，如果唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）兑现对加拿大商品征收25%关税的威胁，加拿大正在制定对美国产品征收广泛关税的计划。【原文：Canada is drawing up plans for extensive tariffs against US products if Donald Trump follows through on his threat to put 25% levies on Canadian goods, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 欧盟将支持德拉吉关于落后于美国和中国的警告
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一份报告草案，欧盟将警告说，欧盟单一市场的一体化进程正在放缓，与此同时，欧盟正面临着包括美国和中国在内的全球主要经济体日益加剧的压力。【原文：The European Union is set to warn that the integration of the bloc’s single market is slowing down at the same time it’s facing stiffening pressure from major global economies including the US and China, according to a draft report seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 从六张图表看英国今年糟糕的市场开局
item.description: 新年伊始，投资者对英国的财政状况忧心忡忡，英国资产遭遇了一个可怕的开局，这让人们再次回忆起 2022 年的市场危机，当时的前首相利兹-特拉斯（Liz Truss）因此下台。【原文：UK assets have suffered a horrendous start to the new year as investors fret about the country’s finances, reigniting memories of a market crisis in 2022 that brought down former Prime Minister Liz Truss.】

item.title: TikTok 最高法院的冲突将言论自由与美国安全对立起来
item.description: TikTok 社交媒体平台的未来取决于美国最高法院的一场冲突，这场冲突将国家安全与言论自由对立起来，将一位总统与另一位总统对立起来。【原文：The future of the wildly popular social media platform TikTok rides on a US Supreme Court clash that pits national security against free speech – and one president against another.】

item.title: 火星公司筹集 10 亿美元私人债务，为发行更大规模债券拉开序幕
item.description: 知情人士透露，玛氏公司正在通过私人配售债券借入相当于 10 亿美元的资金，因为该公司开始偿还为帮助收购食品制造商 Kellanova 而借入的银行贷款。【原文：Mars Inc. is borrowing the equivalent of $1 billion through privately-placed bonds, people with knowledge of the matter said, as it begins to repay bank loans it took out to help buy foodmaker Kellanova.】

item.title: 在全球波动中，印度出现自 2020 年以来最大规模的债券外流
item.description: 海外投资者抛售印度债务的速度是自大流行病以来从未有过的，因为全球债券市场因担心通胀持续而出现抛售。【原文：Overseas investors sold Indian debt at a pace not seen since the pandemic, as bond markets around the world sold off due to jitters about sticky inflation.】

item.title: 台湾部长称特朗普的影响力受其单一任期限制
item.description: 台湾经济部长表示，唐纳德-特朗普及其政策的影响将是有限的，因为他只能担任一个任期。这番罕见的坦率言论表明，世界各国政府正在如何博弈这位当选总统的重新上任。【原文：Taiwan’s economic minister said the impact of Donald Trump and his policies will be limited because he can only serve a single term, rare frank comments that show how governments around the world are gaming out the president-elect’s return to office.】

item.title: 花旗策略师称全球股市到 2025 年底将反弹 10
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Global stocks are likely to rally 10% this year, underpinned by robust corporate earnings growth and equity gains broadening outside the US, according to Citigroup Inc. strategists.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚人担心贪污腐败，彼得罗的不支持率上升
item.description: 由于哥伦比亚人对腐败和犯罪问题忧心忡忡，古斯塔沃-彼得罗总统的不支持率在 12 月份上升，超过了其他地区领导人。【原文：President Gustavo Petro’s disapproval ratings rose in December, topping that of other regional leaders, as Colombians fret about corruption and crime.】

item.title: 卢拉的不支持率创下新高，巴西人对经济持悲观态度
item.description: 12 月，巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）的不支持率达到了其任期内的最高水平，人们对这位左派总统的经济管理日益不满。【原文：Disapproval of Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva reached the highest level of his term in December on growing frustration with the leftist president’s economic stewardship.】

item.title: 对石油制裁的担忧促使亚洲买家寻求替代品
item.description: 印度和中国的炼油厂增加了从中东和其他地区的原油采购量，因为他们担心进一步限制从俄罗斯和伊朗的进口可能会压制原油供应。【原文：Oil refiners in India and China have increased crude purchases from the Middle East and other regions amid concern that further restrictions on imports from Russia and Iran may crimp access to supplies.】

item.title: 随着经济萎缩，2024 年德国公司破产数量激增
item.description: 2024 年，德国企业破产率猛增近 17%，因为该国企业在经济萎缩的压力下不堪重负。【原文：German company insolvencies jumped almost 17% in 2024 as the country’s businesses buckled under the strain of a shrinking economy.】
